description: Cognitive tasks that intelligent systems aim to augment or automate. Anchored in actual cognitive work physicians perform for principled decisions about automation versus augmentation. Based on the Physician Competency Reference Set synthesizing 150+ competency frameworks.

reference.classification: Physician Competency Reference Set (Englander et al.)
reference.data_source: Physician competency frameworks synthesized from 150+ competency lists
sources: Physician Competency Reference Set: 58 competencies across 8 domains (Englander et al.)
MedHELM Framework: 121 medical tasks in 5 categories for LLM evaluation
Eight Domains: Patient Care, Knowledge for Practice, Practice-Based Learning, Communication, Professionalism, Systems-Based Practice, Interprofessional Collaboration, Personal Development
AI Interaction Modes: Augmentation, Automation, Collaborative, Human-Essential

hierarchy.structure: Eight competency domains with specific cognitive tasks categorized by AI interaction modes and MedHELM framework

items.name: Patient Care
items.description: Core clinical activities including procedures, data gathering, decision-making, and patient education

items.name: Knowledge for Practice
items.description: Application of biomedical, clinical, epidemiological, and social-behavioral sciences to patient care

items.name: Practice-Based Learning and Improvement
items.description: Self-assessment, quality improvement, evidence appraisal, and continuous professional development

items.name: Interpersonal & Communication Skills
items.description: Effective communication with patients, families, colleagues, and maintaining medical records

items.name: Professionalism
items.description: Ethical practice, compassion, accountability, and respect for diversity and patient autonomy

items.name: System-based Practice
items.description: Healthcare system navigation, care coordination, resource stewardship, and quality advocacy

items.name: Interperprofessional Collaboration
items.description: Collaborative practice with other health professionals in team-based care delivery

items.name: Personal & Professional Development
items.description: Self-awareness, coping mechanisms, work-life balance, leadership, and managing uncertainty

items.name: Perform Procedures
items.description: Perform all medical, diagnostic, and surgical procedures considered essential for the area of practice

items.name: Gather Patient Data
items.description: Gather essential and accurate information about patients and their condition through history-taking, physical examination, and the use of laboratory data, imaging, and other tests

items.name: Prioritize Care
items.description: Organize and prioritize responsibilities to provide care that is safe, effective, and efficient

items.name: Interpret Diagnostics
items.description: Interpret laboratory data, imaging studies, and other tests required for the area of practice

items.name: Clinical Decision Making
items.description: Make informed decisions about diagnostic and therapeutic interventions based on patient information and preferences, up-to-date scientific evidence, and clinical judgment

items.name: Develop Care Plans
items.description: Develop and carry out patient management plans

items.name: Patient Counseling
items.description: Counsel and educate patients and their families to empower them to participate in their care and enable shared decision making

items.name: Coordinate Referrals
items.description: Provide appropriate referral of patients including ensuring continuity of care throughout transitions between providers or settings, and following up on patient progress and outcomes

items.name: Preventive Care Delivery
items.description: Provide health care services to patients, families, and communities aimed at preventing health problems or maintaining health

items.name: Clinical Role Modeling
items.description: Provide appropriate role modeling

items.name: Clinical Supervision
items.description: Perform supervisory responsibilities commensurate with one's roles, abilities, and qualifications

items.name: Clinical Investigation
items.description: Demonstrate an investigatory and analytic approach to clinical situations

items.name: Apply Biophysical Science
items.description: Apply established and emerging bio-physical scientific principles fundamental to health care for patients and populations

items.name: Apply Clinical Science
items.description: Apply established and emerging principles of clinical sciences to diagnostic and therapeutic decision-making, clinical problem-solving, and other aspects of evidence-based health care

items.name: Apply Epidemiology
items.description: Apply principles of epidemiological sciences to the identification of health problems, risk factors, treatment strategies, resources, and disease prevention/health promotion efforts for patients and populations

items.name: Apply Social Behavioral Science
items.description: Apply principles of social-behavioral sciences to provision of patient care, including assessment of the impact of psychosocial and cultural influences on health, disease, care-seeking, care compliance, and barriers to and attitudes toward care

items.name: Research Translation
items.description: Contribute to the creation, dissemination, application, and translation of new health care knowledge and practices

items.name: Self Assessment
items.description: Identify strengths, deficiencies, and limits in ones knowledge and expertise

items.name: Goal Setting
items.description: Set learning and improvement goals

items.name: Self Directed Learning
items.description: Identify and perform learning activities that address one's gaps in knowledge, skills, and/or attitude

items.name: Quality Improvement
items.description: Systematically analyze practice using quality improvement methods, and implement changes with the goal of practice improvement

items.name: Feedback Integration
items.description: Incorporate feedback into daily practice

items.name: Evidence Appraisal
items.description: Locate, appraise, and assimilate evidence from scientific studies related to patients' health problems

items.name: Technology Integration
items.description: Use information technology to optimize learning

items.name: Peer Education
items.description: Participate in the education of patients, families, students, trainees, peers and other health professionals

items.name: Population Health Analysis
items.description: Obtain and utilize information about individual patients, populations of patients, or communities from which patients are drawn to improve care

items.name: Knowledge Implementation
items.description: Continually identify, analyze, and implement new knowledge, guidelines, standards, technologies, products, or services that have been demonstrated to improve outcomes

items.name: Patient Communication
items.description: Communicate effectively with patients, families, and the public, as appropriate, across a broad range of socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds

items.name: Professional Communication
items.description: Communicate effectively with colleagues within one's profession or specialty, other health professionals, and health related agencies

items.name: Team Collaboration
items.description: Work effectively with others as a member or leader of a health care team or other professional group

items.name: Clinical Consultation
items.description: Act in a consultative role to other health professionals

items.name: Medical Documentation
items.description: Maintain comprehensive, timely, and legible medical records

items.name: Sensitive Communication
items.description: Demonstrate sensitivity, honesty, and compassion in difficult conversations, including those about death, end of life, adverse events, bad news, disclosure of errors, and other sensitive topics

items.name: Emotional Intelligence
items.description: Demonstrate insight and understanding about emotions and human responses to emotions that allow one to develop and manage interpersonal interactions

items.name: Compassionate Care
items.description: Demonstrate compassion, integrity, and respect for others

items.name: Patient Centered Practice
items.description: Demonstrate responsiveness to patient needs that supersedes self-interest

items.name: Respect Autonomy
items.description: Demonstrate respect for patient privacy and autonomy

items.name: Professional Accountability
items.description: Demonstrate accountability to patients, society and the profession

items.name: Cultural Competence
items.description: Demonstrate sensitivity and responsiveness to a diverse patient population, including but not limited to diversity in gender, age, culture, race, religion, disabilities, and sexual orientation

items.name: Ethical Practice
items.description: Demonstrate a commitment to ethical principles pertaining to provision or withholding of care, confidentiality, informed consent, and business practices, including compliance with relevant laws, policies, and regulations

items.name: System Navigation
items.description: Work effectively in various health care delivery settings and systems relevant to one's clinical specialty

items.name: Care Coordination
items.description: Coordinate patient care within the health care system relevant to one's clinical specialty

items.name: Resource Stewardship
items.description: Incorporate considerations of cost awareness and risk-benefit analysis in patient and/or population-based care

items.name: Quality Advocacy
items.description: Advocate for quality patient care and optimal patient care systems

items.name: System Improvement
items.description: Participate in identifying system errors and implementing potential systems solutions

items.name: Practice Management
items.description: Perform administrative and practice management responsibilities commensurate with one's role, abilities, and qualifications

items.name: Interprofessional Trust
items.description: Work with other health professionals to establish and maintain a climate of mutual respect, dignity, diversity, ethical integrity, and trust

items.name: Interprofessional Assessment
items.description: Use the knowledge of one's own role and the roles of other health professionals to appropriately assess and address the health care needs of the patients and populations served

items.name: Interprofessional Communication
items.description: Communicate with other health professionals in a responsive and responsible manner that supports the maintenance of health and the treatment of disease in individual patients and populations

items.name: Team Leadership
items.description: Participate in different team roles to establish, develop, and continuously enhance interprofessional teams to provide patient- and population-centered care that is safe, timely, efficient, effective, and equitable

items.name: Self Awareness
items.description: Develop the ability to use self-awareness of knowledge, skills and emotional limitations to engage in appropriate help-seeking behaviors

items.name: Stress Management
items.description: Demonstrate healthy coping mechanisms to respond to stress

items.name: Work Life Balance
items.description: Manage conflict between personal and professional responsibilities

items.name: Adaptive Practice
items.description: Practice flexibility and maturity in adjusting to change with the capacity to alter one's behavior

items.name: Professional Trustworthiness
items.description: Demonstrate trustworthiness that makes colleagues feel secure when one is responsible for the care of patients

items.name: Leadership Development
items.description: Provide leadership skills that enhance team functioning, the learning environment, and/or the health care delivery system

items.name: Therapeutic Presence
items.description: Demonstrate self-confidence that puts patients, families, and members of the health care team at ease

items.name: Uncertainty Management
items.description: Recognize that ambiguity is part of clinical health care and respond by utilizing appropriate resources in dealing with uncertainty
